title: NASA Expands Youth Engagement With New Scouting America Agreement
summary: NASA and the Sam Houston Area Council (SHAC) of Scouting America signed a collaborative Space Act Agreement on December 17, 2024, expanding youth access to programs and opportunities with the Johnson Space Center’s Office of STEM Engagement (OSTEM) in Houston. The agreement forges the first formal partnership between NASA OSTEM and Scouting America. It will […]

title: NASA scrambles to cut ISS activity after Trump budget—its options are not great
summary: "The Budget reduces the space station’s crew size and onboard research."

title: House Democrats seek information from NASA and the Pentagon on Musk conflicts of interest and SpaceX foreign investment
summary:
Democratic leaders of two House committee are asking NASA and the Defense Department to investigate claims that SpaceX takes investment from Chinese sources as well as broader conflict-of-interest concerns.

title: What Is a Black Hole? (Grades 5-8)
summary: This article is for students grades 5-8 A black hole is a region in space where the pulling force of gravity is so strong that light is not able to escape. The strong gravity occurs because matter has been pressed into a tiny space. This compression can take place at the end of a star’s […]

title: NASA Selects Winners of the 2024-2025 Power to Explore Challenge
summary: NASA has chosen three winners out of nine finalists in the fourth annual Power to Explore Challenge, a national writing competition designed to teach K-12 students about the enabling power of radioisotopes for space exploration. The essay competition asked students to learn about NASA’s radioisotope power systems (RPS), likened to “nuclear batteries,” which the agency […]

title: Resilience lunar lander enters orbit around the moon
summary:
Japanese company ispace says its second lunar lander in now in orbit around the moon ahead of a landing attempt in early June.

title: Forest satellite’s big antenna opens up
summary: Just a week after its launch, ESA’s Biomass mission has reached another critical milestone on its path to delivering unprecedented insights into the world’s forests and their vital role in Earth’s carbon cycle – the satellite’s 12-metre-diameter antenna is now fully deployed.

title: Research Fellows in space science 2025
summary: ESA has selected 10 new Fellows to pursue their own independent research in space science, starting in 2025.
